overview:
Mike Walsh has been a software entrepreneur for over fifteen years and is currently the Vice President of Product Management and co-founder at Anagraph Medical Solutions. He has worked for a variety of venture backed and bootstrapped companies in software development and information technology roles. His first startup was Clinical NetwoRx, a clinical software company where he was a founder and co-author of the Clinical Master product. Clinical NetwoRx was sold in 1998 to Hollister, Inc and Mike was name Vice President of Products and Services.

Mike became Chief Information Officer for Revit Technology in 1999. Revit was a venture backed publisher of computer aided design software for the architecture, engineering, and construction market. While CIO, he led a team that created a pioneering ecommerce system for a self-service subscription sales model. Revit was acquired by Autodesk (ADSK) in 2002.

Mike moved on to serve as Director of Information Technology for AppIQ, Inc. AppIQ was the publisher of Storage Authority, the industry leading storage area management system for heterogeneous storage systems. While with AppIQ, Mike provided electronic marketing, sales, and licensing systems to AppIQ’s large OEM channel, while also maintaining a sizable mobile communication device network. AppIQ was acquired by Hewlett Packard (HPQ) in 2005.

Mike has a Bachelor of Science from Cornell University and a Masters in Business Administration from Bentley University.
